meanings.definition: A flat-topped or convex inflorescence in which the individual flower stalks grow upward from various points on the main stem to approximately the same height.
meanings.sent1: The corymbs of white flowers created a beautiful display in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The gardener arranged the corymbs of roses in a vase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the corymbs of the sunflowers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bloomed like the corymbs of a spring garden.
meanings.sent5: The corymbs swayed gently in the breeze, a floral symphony in motion.

meanings.definition: A cluster of flowers in which the central or terminal flower opens first.
meanings.sent1: The corymbs of daisies in the field were a mix of closed buds and open blooms.
meanings.sent2: As the sun rose, the corymbs of morning glories unfurled one by one.
meanings.sent3: The race between the corymbs of the tulips to bloom first was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her smile burst forth like the central corymbs of a firework.
meanings.sent5: The corymbs seemed to compete in a floral contest of who could open first.
